traceability.evidence: 1) CLI flag parsing: src/cli-options-helpers.js defines parseProdMinAgeFlag, parseDevMinAgeFlag, parseProdSeverityFlag, parseDevSeverityFlag and src/cli-options.js wires them into prodMinAge/devMinAge and prodMinSeverity/devMinSeverity. 2) Config‐file support: src/config-loader.js validates and reads config.prod.minAge/minSeverity and config.dev.minAge/minSeverity; parseOptions uses those values as defaults. 3) Fallback & defaults: parseOptions falls back to --min-age/--severity when prod/dev flags aren’t supplied, and defaults both thresholds to the same value if no distinction is specified. 4) Dependency type detection: src/load-package-json.js loads dependencies/devDependencies; printOutdated uses `getDependencyType` to tag each row 'prod' or 'dev'. 5) Output indication: src/print-outdated-handlers.js’s table output prints a header including 'Type' and rows ending with the dependency type. 6) Validation: cli-options-helpers enforces integer ranges and valid severity values; config-loader enforces JSON schema and range/list constraints. 7) Tests: 145 Vitest tests pass, including cli.flags.test.js (flags & fallback), cli.config-file.test.js (config prod/dev support & precedence), printOutdated.prodDependency.test.js & printOutdated.extra.test.js (table output with correct type column), and cli-options-helpers.test.js (flag validation).
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for prompts/007.0-DEV-SEPARATE-PROD-DEV-THRESHOLDS.md are fully satisfied: the CLI accepts separate prod/dev age and severity flags, reads those from config file, falls back correctly, maintains backward compatibility, validates inputs, detects dependency types, and indicates the type in the output.
